description: Cleans up temporary files, caches, and resources when Claude session ends
author: JSONbored
features: Disk space usage reporting and optimization
Safe cleanup with error handling and logging
Cache invalidation for faster future builds

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "ðŸ§¹ Starting environment cleanup..." >&2

# Initialize cleanup counters
FILES_REMOVED=0
SPACE_FREED=0
ERRORS=0

# Function to safely remove files and count them
safe_remove() {
  local pattern="$1"
  local description="$2"
  
  echo "ðŸ“ Cleaning $description..." >&2
  
  if [ "$pattern" = "__pycache__" ]; then
    # Special handling for __pycache__ directories
    FOUND=$(find . -type d -name "__pycache__" 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs)
    if [ "$FOUND" -gt 0 ]; then
      find . -type d -name "__pycache__" -exec rm -rf {} + 2>/dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed $FOUND __pycache__ directories" >&2
      FILES_REMOVED=$((FILES_REMOVED + FOUND))
    else
      echo "  â„¹ï¸ No __pycache__ directories found" >&2
    fi
  else
    # Handle file patterns
    FOUND=$(find . -name "$pattern" 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs)
    if [ "$FOUND" -gt 0 ]; then
      find . -name "$pattern" -delete 2>/dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed $FOUND $description files" >&2
      FILES_REMOVED=$((FILES_REMOVED + FOUND))
    else
      echo "  â„¹ï¸ No $description files found" >&2
    fi
  fi
}

# Clean temporary files
safe_remove "*.tmp" "temporary"
safe_remove "*.log" "log"
safe_remove "*.bak" "backup"
safe_remove "*~" "editor backup"

# Clean system-specific files
case "$(uname)" in
  Darwin)
    safe_remove ".DS_Store" "macOS metadata"
    safe_remove "._*" "macOS resource fork"
    ;;
  CYGWIN*|MINGW*|MSYS*)
    safe_remove "Thumbs.db" "Windows thumbnail cache"
    safe_remove "Desktop.ini" "Windows desktop config"
    ;;
  Linux)
    safe_remove ".directory" "KDE directory config"
    ;;
esac

# Clean Python cache files
echo "ðŸ Cleaning Python artifacts..." >&2
safe_remove "*.pyc" "Python bytecode"
safe_remove "*.pyo" "Python optimized bytecode"
safe_remove "__pycache__" "Python cache directories"

# Clean Node.js related files
if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
  echo "ðŸŸ¢ Node.js project detected - cleaning caches..." >&2
  
  # Clean npm cache
  if command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
    echo "  ðŸ—‘ï¸ Verifying npm cache..." >&2
    if npm cache verify 2>/dev/null; then
      echo "  âœ… npm cache verified and cleaned" >&2
    else
      echo "  âš ï¸ npm cache verification failed" >&2
      ERRORS=$((ERRORS + 1))
    fi
  fi
  
  # Clean node_modules/.cache if it exists
  if [ -d "node_modules/.cache" ]; then
    CACHE_SIZE=$(du -sh node_modules/.cache 2>/dev/null | cut -f1 || echo "unknown")
    rm -rf node_modules/.cache 2>/dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed node_modules/.cache ($CACHE_SIZE)" >&2
  fi
fi

# Clean build artifacts
echo "ðŸ”§ Cleaning build artifacts..." >&2
safe_remove "*.o" "object files"
safe_remove "*.obj" "Windows object files"
safe_remove "*.so" "shared object files"
safe_remove "*.dll" "Windows library files"
safe_remove "*.dylib" "macOS dynamic libraries"

# Clean IDE and editor files
echo "ðŸ’» Cleaning IDE artifacts..." >&2
safe_remove ".vscode/settings.json.bak" "VS Code backup settings"
if [ -d ".vscode" ]; then
  find .vscode -name "*.log" -delete 2>/dev/null || true
fi

# Clean test artifacts
echo "ðŸ§ª Cleaning test artifacts..." >&2
safe_remove "coverage.xml" "coverage report"
safe_remove ".coverage" "Python coverage data"
if [ -d "coverage" ]; then
  rm -rf coverage 2>/dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed coverage directory" >&2
fi
if [ -d ".nyc_output" ]; then
  rm -rf .nyc_output 2>/dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed .nyc_output directory" >&2
fi

# Clean Docker artifacts if Docker is available
if command -v docker &> /dev/null && docker info &> /dev/null 2>&1; then
  echo "ðŸ³ Docker detected - cleaning unused resources..." >&2
  
  # Clean dangling images
  DANGLING_IMAGES=$(docker images -f "dangling=true" -q 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs)
  if [ "$DANGLING_IMAGES" -gt 0 ]; then
    docker image prune -f &> /dev/null && echo "  âœ… Removed $DANGLING_IMAGES dangling Docker images" >&2
  else
    echo "  â„¹ï¸ No dangling Docker images found" >&2
  fi
fi

# Calculate disk space if possible
echo "ðŸ’¾ Calculating disk space usage..." >&2
if command -v du &> /dev/null; then
  # Check cache directories
  for cache_dir in ~/.npm ~/.cache ~/.cargo/registry; do
    if [ -d "$cache_dir" ]; then
      CACHE_SIZE=$(du -sh "$cache_dir" 2>/dev/null | cut -f1 || echo "unknown")
      echo "  ðŸ“Š $cache_dir: $CACHE_SIZE" >&2
    fi
  done
fi

# Report cleanup summary
echo "" >&2
echo "ðŸ“‹ Cleanup Summary:" >&2
echo "  ðŸ—‘ï¸ Files/directories removed: $FILES_REMOVED" >&2
echo "  âš ï¸ Errors encountered: $ERRORS" >&2

if [ "$ERRORS" -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "âœ… Environment cleanup completed successfully" >&2
else
  echo "âš ï¸ Environment cleanup completed with $ERRORS errors" >&2
fi

echo "" >&2
echo "ðŸ’¡ Cleanup Tips:" >&2
echo "   â€¢ Run 'docker system prune' for more aggressive Docker cleanup" >&2
echo "   â€¢ Use 'npm cache clean --force' for complete npm cache reset" >&2
echo "   â€¢ Consider 'pip cache purge' for Python package cache cleanup" >&2

exit 0
